extendedInfo.description: This is an Unique app to show your heart beat on the screen. This app measures heart beat automatically, when you place your index finger on the camera. For precise measurements: It is preferable to use a high end mobile phone/tablet with flash light. Sit in a rested position. Keep your finger on the camera and not on the flashlight. Try to keep your finger still and do not shake the device, while taking the measurement. Use the app in a bright environment, when flash light is not available. Provide ample lighting to pass through your fingers. It is possible to take readings using the front camera for Tablet devices.Keyword:Heart rate monitor,fitness,pulse.timer,health.

reviews.title: Not Bad
reviews.comment: I you want to see an EKG for any length of time this app is not what you are looking for. Is good just to get apilse rate.
reviews.author: John Michael Braunm

reviews.title: OW
reviews.comment: This burned my finger tip... I have VERY tough hands but couldn\'t keep my finger over the flash LED for more than a couple of seconds.... True this may just be down to my phone but be warned....
reviews.author: Phil Jones

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: I am actually surprised how well this works on my (2012) Nexus 7, and how easy it is to use. It works perfectly near a sunlit window, under a table lamp, or with a flashlight. The Nexus doesn\'t have a flash, so the external source is required. Had about a one minute learning curve until I figured out just how to place my finger and how hard to press, and after that no issues. Great concept and good job!
reviews.author: Ron Seehoffer

reviews.title: Works for the Nexus 7
reviews.comment: I was looking for something that would monitor my heart rate on my Nexus 7.  This app and the Runtastic Heart Monitor are the only ones I found so I tried them both.  After reading the reviews from Nexus 7 users here I didn\'t think this would work - but it does.  So far I\'ve only used it in well lit rooms, but it quickly finds my pulse and records it accurately. I tested it against normal heart monitors and it gets a good reading.   The Runtastic app couldn\'t find my pulse most of the time.  When it does it takes a long time and it records a low reading  (while exercising it recorded it at 48 when the machine said 111).  Also, the Runtastic only allows 3 readings per day.  The Precise Heart Rate app doesn\'t sync with any fitness apps, but I don\'t imagine most people will be out running carrying a Nexus 7.  So if you have a Nexus 7, this is the app I\'d recommend.
reviews.author: JC Carlyle

reviews.comment: Good but sure about the accuracy.

reviews.title: Continuous display please
reviews.comment: This is the only app working perfectly on my Slow android. Please add feature to display heart rate **Continuously** instead of stopping after 10 seconds.
